title: How to stay home and study without the internet - Quora

response.answer_text: Books! If you want theoretical knowledge, you can subscribe to newsletters, magazines, get a library card if you have one near, or simply buy the books you need from stores if it is feasible. It’s not necessary to buy new books only, second-hand stuff is also alright. If that also isn’t in your budget, then you can ask your friends/ neighbours/ family to teach you if they live in your vicinity. If you want practical knowledge - you’ll either need a hands-on approach from a qualified individual, or someone who actually works in that particular domain to get a hang of the subject/work/process. There are also colleges that provide at-home education by mailing (via post) learning materials and assessments which are posted for evaluation. Honestly, the avenues for studies are many. You just have to search for them :) Cheers and happy learning!

You can follow these:- 1)If you have someone in your neighbour who has the books required by you,you can ask for those. 2)Study those portions of the book(which you have) which were/are uncovered by you. 3)There are currently some educational channels,which run live classes,of which you can take help. Please upvote if you find my answer useful.
